>
> In th=
e recent thread "New To NEAT - A few Newbie Questions" Ken wrote:

t you do is evaluate each

ampion of each
> >generation on the validation set. When the validation sco=
res start
> >going down, you stop evolution.
> 
> I am using SharpNEAT and =
am new to all this so I would appreciate a
> little more detail.
> 
> I hav=
e implemented two interface, IExperiment and INetworkEvaluator.
> Neither i=
nterface appears to have any concept of a generation or of a
> champion. It=
 looks to me like I might want/need to subclass
> SingleFilePopulationEvalu=
ator so that I can override

class' EvaluatePopulation
> and after it completes do my validation testing=
 on the
> EvolutionAlgorithm's BestGenome. I was then thinking
> that once =
I wished to stop evolution, I could set the
> EvolutionAlgorithm SearchComp=
leted boolean. Finally, I can modify
> SharpNeatGui's SearchThread to check=
 the ea's SearchCompleted flag so
> that the thread will stop.

 the right track here? How have others handled cross-validation
> and preve=
ntion of over-fitting?

> Peter

Hello Peter,
My name is Kr=
asimir Trifonov and I am also new in the group. I
implemented cross-validat=
ion using Ken's and yours suggestion, but
there are some observation I made=
 which I want to share with you and
the group.
